creator: simoon79@interfree.it
text:
This is the error I encountered on red hat 3 ES after installation ex-novo of 
the OS and the Apache WebServer 2.54
 --------------------------- 
 ./configure --prefix=/ps/ws
 ---------------------------
checking for chosen layout... Apache
checking for working mkdir -p... yes
checking build system type... i686-pc-linux-gnu
checking host system type... i686-pc-linux-gnu
checking target system type... i686-pc-linux-gnu
Configuring Apache Portable Runtime library ...
checking for APR... reconfig
configuring package in srclib/apr now
checking build system type... i686-pc-linux-gnu
checking host system type... i686-pc-linux-gnu
checking target system type... i686-pc-linux-gnu
Configuring APR library
Platform: i686-pc-linux-gnu
checking for working mkdir -p... yes
APR Version: 0.9.6
checking for chosen layout... apr
checking for gcc... gcc
checking for C compiler default output file name... configure: error: C 
compiler cannot create executables
See `config.log' for more details.
configure failed for srclib/apr

May you help in solve it?

Thanks

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
1) do you have gcc installed?

2) please attach the srclib/apr/config.log file to the bug report

here the config.log in srclib/apr

creator: simoon79@interfree.it

text: And yes, gcc 3.2.3 (Red Hat 3 Es embedded) was installed
creator: simoon79@interfree.it
jorton@redhat.com
text:
configure:2981: checking for C compiler default output file name
configure:2984: gcc    conftest.c lpthread >&5

it looks like you have LIBS set to "lpthread" in the environment.

creator: simoon79@interfree.it
text:
Hi,
lpthreads is set for requirement of another application which want Apache 
compiled with LIBS=lpthread, and eventually the option --enable-module=so. but 
now I'm trying simply to install the web server. 
This is important, I try to install version 2.0.46 and had the same error
Think I need some particular packages?

Thanks a lot
Use LIBS="-lpthread" then though it should not be necessary with 2.0.54.
creator: jorton@redhat.com

text:
(In reply to comment #6)
> Use LIBS="-lpthread" then though it should not be necessary with 2.0.54.

Yes, but still not working
creator: simoon79@interfree.it
jorton@redhat.com
text:
Please do not reopen this bug.  If you are still having problems building httpd,
please mail users@httpd.apache.org and post a link to the config.log produced,
with LIBS="-lpthread" (not the hyphen).
